critique: The document aims to convey a sense of hope and confidence in the government's ability to address the economic crisis through careful planning and resource management. The establishment of the National Resources Committee signals a proactive approach to utilizing emergency appropriations wisely. The emphasis on collaboration with various agencies and the focus on providing information to the President suggest a desire to inspire trust and optimism. However, there is also an element of seriousness and determination, given the context of the Great Depression. The language is formal and authoritative, reflecting the gravity of the situation.
